alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 9:55PM MDT until further notice by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Flows along streams and creeks are elevated and out of their banks in some areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 948 PM MDT, emergency management has reported minor flooding along creeks and streams with standing water along some roadways. This includes minor flooding along the Little Goose Creek and Big Goose Creek, as well as other small tributaries in the area. The public also reported water over Woodland Park Road at Little Goose Bridge at 800 PM MDT this evening. - Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen today in the area. Additional rainfall is not expected this evening, however creeks are expected to see some additional rises from upstream runoff. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sheridan and Big Horn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
